11:16 Things I noticed: -Instant Health, Haste 2, Slow Falling, and Water Breathing are listed twice -Speed 2, Luck 2, Jump Boost 2, Night Vision 2, and Resistance 2 are also listed twice, but with different icons -Fire Resistance 2 & Absorption 2 are not listed once, not twice, but THREE TIMES. Twice with the same icon, once with a different one -Techno Power. -Gotta Go Fast I might have missed some, especially since there are a few behind the pig, but I just wanted to throw this out there because I'm a sucker for details and pointless trivia. I know others have pointed out the reference effects but I wanted to lump them in with the duplicates bc why not

Blue: Disappeared after being hit with a potion by the fake Second Coming.  The Second Coming: Alive and confronts the fake Blue, later fights the Witch.  Green: Alive and fights the Witch on the roof as a sugarcane.  Red: Turned into cobblestone by the Witch, later turned back into a stick figure by Blue's potion.  Yellow: Turned into a witch by the Witch, later turned back into a stick figure by Blue's potion.  The Pig: Initially alive, taken by the Witch, later saved by Reuben and becomes super-powerful.  The Witch: Defeated and turned into dye by the Pig's powerful attacks.  Reuben: Initially missing, later drinks spilled potions and becomes super-powerful.  Purple: Alive and reunites with the group, leads them to another Nether Portal.

11:15 It says that the pig has invisibility, so why is it still visible?
As we can see: - Red is good at textures - Yellow is good at redstone - Green is good at noteblocks - Blue is good at potions - Animator AKA Orange is good at parkour
Blue re-emerges from the Nether Portal, where he's relieved to be back in a... swamp? Wait a minute, this isn't ALANSPC! He asks The Second Coming, who had just appeared, who gestures to Blue to come closer. As Blue does so, he sees the true identity of the fake Second Coming off-camera and tries to run, but is hit with a potion, and disappears.  The real Second Coming, Green, Red and, Yellow come out of the portal shortly after, where they reunite with Blue. Showing that Blue managed to obtain some Nether Wart, the Stick Figure Team celebrate and leave. Blue, however, seems hesitant to leave, and stops Red. One at a time, the remaining stick figures go back in the portal, as each stick that went before them takes longer and longer to return. TSC is the last one to enter the portal again. Finding that the other stick figures are nowhere to be seen, TSC confronts "Blue", who suddenly begins attacks TSC with a barrage of potions. Fending the attacks off, TSC manages to pin "Blue" to the ground, who turns out to be a witch that has captured the Fighting Stick Figures. The witch then drinks a potion of invisibility, and disappears.  TSC feels hopeless now that the Witch is gone, but Red's Heroic Pig (Reuben) comforts him. They set off in search of the other stick figures. As they are searching, they come across a group of llamas. The Heroic Pig sniffs out Yellow, and as TSC walks by, one of them makes llama noises, claiming to be Yellow. TSC nearly celebrates, but he had to test the llama first, telling it to build a redstone contraption to prove whether or not the llama is indeed Yellow (because Yellow is a genius at Redstone Minecraft). The llama ends up building a contraption that makes an armor stand of Yellow. Satisfied, TSC gives Yellow a yellow tapestry, and the three set off once more.  While crossing the swamp, a salmon jumps on TSC and he shakes it off. They continued and the salmon lands next to TSC. He was about to kick it when Reuben stops him. It then sniffs the salmon after a while, and deduces that it is Red (salmon have red scales). TSC is still skeptical, so he holds some wool with different colors (which are their names) and is surprised when the salmon jumps at the red wool. Now convinced, TSC carries Red in a bucket, and the group continues.  The group soon comes across a zombie, which TSC tries to kill. However, before TSC attacks the Zombie, it motions for TSC to stop, and gestures itself to be Green. However, TSC forgot to test the zombie to see if it's really Green, and as the adventure goes on, the zombie suddenly begins to start attacking the group with a diamond sword in each hand. Confused, the Stick Gang fought back, before the zombie takes Reuben with it. The zombie takes out a potion, revealing itself to be the Witch, splashes it, creating a void, then escapes through it, taking Reuben with it.  TSC and the group grew hopeless again, and sat down. Without Reuben, they can't find Green, Blue, and the Witch. Suddenly, the sugarcane next to TSC nudges him, claiming to be Green. Wary due to the previous attack, TSC demands the sugarcane to prove itself, holding out a Note Block. The sugar cane then proceeds to play Jazzy Note Blocks, proving that it was Green. Green knows where the Witch is headed, so TSC shovels Green out and continue, this time to search for Witch and Reuben.  At the Witch's hut it is revealed that Blue has been transformed into a piston to harvest nether wart. However, Blue himself does not realize that he is a piston, he merely thinks he is sitting in a blank white place. Nether warts would regularly appear before him, but whenever he tries to grab them they would vanish again. Meanwhile, TSC, Red, Green, and Yellow, arrive at the Witch's hut and prepare to attack the witch. They hear Reuben squealing for help. This provokes Red, who attacks first but gets turned into cobblestone. Yellow throws TNT but the witch dodges it. Green is able to fight the witch the roof as a sugarcane, Yellow throws more TNT at the Witch, and the Witch continues to fight them back. Blue suddenly hears Yellow's TNT explosion, and is now able to move around. He looks for any potions, but the Witch is about to enter the room. Reuben warns Blue and Blue dives underwater, finding a brewing stand and a chest full of supplies. He starts making potions.  The Witch begins to win the fight by turning the rest of the group into useless and yet not immobile blocks. The witch is about to kill Green, but Blue throws a potion that turns him back into a stick figure. He throws potions at everyone else. They prepare to fight again, but the Witch throws a splash potion at her supplies, giving them life which provides the Witch with constant potions. Everyone begins fighting: the Witch uses her potions to turn the Sticks into useless objects, and Blue turns the Sticks into powerful mobs.    The Witch grabbed Yellow and turned him into a witch, so no one can tell who's who. TSC asked Red to get the potions, but the real Witch sneakily dropped a Void potion, which transported her to the hut. She ambushed Red and turned him into a redstone block and threw him out. They spilled a chest full of potions. Blue ambushed the Witch and both used potions to turn into various mobs to defeat each other, but in the end, Blue runs out of potions and the sticks are turned into colored dyes. The witch tries to burn them and nearly finishes them off, but suddenly, inside the hut, Reuben has drunk a bunch of the potions that were spilled from the chest. Reuben becomes super-powerful and launches itself at the witch, killing the Witch's moving chest supplies in the process. It begins doing crazy attacks on the Witch. The Witch tries to get away from the big by using a black hole, but the pig also went through it. The witch also tried to turn the pig into a colored dye, but the pig turns the witch into dye using its own potion against it. He finishes the Witch by giving it a super-powerful punch, sending the Witch far, far away. The pig goes back into the hut, pushes another chest full of potions that turn the dyes back into stick figures, making Reuben the Heroic Pig. All five of them hug Reuben.  Soon, everyone is about to leave the swamp, but they hear a sound. They see Purple, who is collecting blue orchids for no apparent reason. They have a reunion where Purple shows them another Nether Portal that he wants to show them. TSC remembers what happened the last time they went into an adventure: entering through unknown Nether portals, which lead to getting separated; TSC fighting the Killer Bunny; The Fighting Stick Figures escaping from the Drowned; and fighting the Spider King. Red begins to go first but TSC stops him, and tells everyone they should go home. As the five go home, Purple comes out. Red looks back and says they should follow Purple and see what he wants to show them. Everyone agrees except TSC, but he follows everyone to Purple anyway. They go through the portal and the episode ends.

if you pay attention to the point when all the effects appear on the pig, you can see two that don't exist in regular minecraft and one that's negative(maybe). Last one in the third column is Gotta Go Fast, and seventh in the last column is Techno Power, probably a reference to Technoblade, making him "never die" ba-dum-tschh. And, sixth in the second column has a symbol that looks to be Bad Omen's pillager and two axes, but most of it is covered by the pig's head. Just something I noticed.

God cannot allow a single sin into Heaven because he is a Holy God. The punishment for sin is Hell, and we are all sinners. God does not want anyone to go to Hell. God loves us so much that he sent his only begotten son to die for our sins. His son, Jesus Christ, took on all of sin when he died on the cross for us. Jesus Christâ€™s blood washes away all of our sins. Believe in your heart that God raised Jesus Christ from the dead on the third day. This gift of salvation and eternal life is a free gift of God. By the grace of God, we are saved by faith alone, not of ourselves or our works.   None of us know when we will die. Accepting Jesus Christ as our Lord and Savior and getting saved allows us to have this gift of eternal life in Heaven. Repent. Put your faith in what Jesus Christ did on the cross to save you. Trust in Jesus Christ to save you. Believe in, trust, and have faith in the Gospel, the death, burial, and resurrection of Jesus Christ.  If you are sincere about this, say a prayer to God about it!  A couple of resources:   Check out "How to Get Saved" and "The Gospel" by Robert Breaker on YouTube, and check out "How to Get Saved and Be a REAL Bible-Believer" by Gene Kim (REAL Bible Believers) on YouTube. Acts 16:30-31  30 And brought them out, and said, Sirs, what must I do to be saved?  31 And they said, Believe on the Lord Jesus Christ, and thou shalt be saved, and thy house.   Ephesians 2:8-9  8 For by grace are ye saved through faith; and that not of yourselves: it is the gift of God:  9 Not of works, lest any man should boast. Ah yes, the best potion effects, Gotta Go Fast and Techno Power
So uh, I did the math and that witch logically died half way through, probably drank some sort of potion to keep going, as they did quite abit of that.  ( Spoilers )                            feel free to correct my math but the point still stands: Considering the humanoid form ( or stance ) the pig takes in some scenes, I'll assume its 1 heart + 260% from Str II according to one site, which is 3.6, so that times how many hits done ( Without slow mode I counted 41ish hits ), 45 is what I counted with slow mode and I'm 100% sure I missed quite a few, but I'm sticking with it; Plug that in and we have 162, 2 points equal a heart so 81â€¬ DMG total, on my first search of how much HP a witch has, I got 26, which means they got over-killed by 3.115384615384615 TIMES their total HP.   This math is most likely way off but I am 100% sure that if you did it correctly, the value obtained would have been enough to render that witch *dead*, no matter the difficulty setting.  Should be noted it took like from 11:16 all the way to 11:40 and a second later to launch them ( 24-25 SEC ) for when the last punch connected: Those potion effects last 3 minutes, this pig could of done this 7-8 times over.  And Ironically this isn't the first time they were like this, so they even got experience for it too, the only difference now is there are more potion effects added than last time.      I'm loving all the little references and what not of this animation, plus I just cant stop watching the pig fight scene, love how smart the witch is- and I love how the pig ignored all of this witch's "smart" tropes, like following them into their portal to combo them as they try to make space or escape while literally throwing those potions back at them, thats one of the many weaknesses of a witch ingame, dodging their attacks or obstructions.   I see that pig made good use of their Techno-Power Potion effect, I respect that.  Cool things that I don't think were intentional but I should add: The pig = guinea pig ( Perhaps for experiments ) Their humanoid + Beast fighting style might be a sort of resonance of their Pigman form ( im not referring to piglins or Zombie pigmen/piglins ).

LOL
I have a theory on why this witch is so powerful. We can see that the background, as far as we can see, is a swamp. We know that there are many different worlds, and this one is likely an all swamp one. Because of this, at some point in the past, there would be an insane number of witches. As with any form of society, someone had to be in charge or it would all go to heck. I think that they then had a fight over who would be the ruler, and I feel that this witch, in order to win, had no choice but to think outside of the box. Instead of standard potions, she invented new ones. Instead of just throwing potions, she practiced hand-to-hand combat. The witch ended up winning, but through either overkill on her part (destroying them), or rejection on their part, although she was the winner, she ended up alone, with nothing to do but brew more potions.
This season must called the nether loop

I like the idea of a episode based around mods. Especially moments like when you first download a mod, multiple mods, mod packs, specific packs that add certain worlds and even their own story. But also the downsides of mods, when you have too many mods, when you have those super obscure mods that literally do nothing, and especially the moment when mods get really boring. Like that moment when they get too grindy, or they remove the challenge of Minecraft to the point where itâ€™s just too easy. The mods that make Minecraft no longer Minecraft at all, and turn it into an entirely different thing. I feel like thereâ€™s definitely something there, it would be pretty cool to see if you ever tackle this concept!

I love this one so much!! First off, I don't know how, but the animation seems to get better each episode, like the combination of the small little details like the larger smears for the sugar cane as opposed to the brief ones for the swords, everything's just so amazing!! Secondly, I love all the callback to the previous shorts too, like with green and his music!! Also, I don't know if this one was fully intentional or not, but one of my favorite things is the dynamic between red & blue I love it so much!! Especially how in the last one red (arguably) looked the most torn up over finding out blue was missing, and how red kinda hung back with his arm around (fake) blue once they found him cuz he was happy he found him (idk I might be reading a little too much into it, but if not, I absolutely love all those little fine details) Anyways, sorry for my rant, absolutely loved this episode (could ya tell?), and props to all the animators!!

After much suffering, the red reaches the mountain first then he finds a mysterious creature, the goat, as it is a new animal for him, he decides to domesticate the goat, and he succeeds, only when the others arrive together at the top of the mountain, the goat gets scared and ends up pushing everyone, except the red one, and everyone else ends up falling at the Lush Caves, the red one jumps off the mountain to help them (making a mlg), and arrives at the Lush Caves too, so the blue is fascinated with the amount of flora that has in that cave, and red ends up discovering another creature, Axolotl... Nature magazine recently published its list of the ten most influential scientists of the year. One of them is Professor Wendy Rogers of Clinical Ethics at Macquarie University of Australia.  Professor Rogers started paying attention to transplantation ethics in 2015 after watching the documentary Hard to Believe. The following year, she became the chair of a nonprofit organization International Coalition to End Transplant Abuse in China (ETAC).  She led a team to review research papers published by Chinese transplant doctors. She believed the teamâ€™s findings, which were published in February 2019, would curb forced organ transplants in China.  Nature cited that a group of international experts had drawn the same conclusion as Professor Rogers. The group, led by Sir Geoffrey Nice, an attorney experienced in prosecuting war criminals, published a paper that questioned the Chinese communist regimeâ€™s reported number of transplants and concluded that more prisoners of conscience had their vital organs forcibly taken and that the crime is very likely ongoing.  Under former Party chief Jiang Zemin, the Chinese Communist Party (CCP) launched a nationwide persecution of Falun Gong in July 1999. It established the 610 Office, an extralegal institution whose sole function was to eradicate Falun Gong, under directives to â€œruin [practitionersâ€™] reputation, bankrupt them financially, and destroy them physically.â€  Since then, more than 4,300 practitioners are confirmed to have died as a direct result of persecution, and untold numbers have been imprisoned, tortured, subjected to brainwashing and forced labor, and even had their organs taken and sold for transplantation.  The communist regime utilized all state agencies to persecute Falun Gong and implemented a policy of â€œ[counting] all deaths of Falun Gong practitioners as suicidesâ€ and â€œto cremate their bodies without documenting their identities.â€  Many jailed practitioners underwent frequent blood tests and other physical tests in prisons and forced labor camps. At the same time, a large number of practitioners disappeared.

Wow
This video got me to shed a tear. Not because I'm sad, but because I'm not used to watching videos that perform the basic function of making me feel some semblance of an emotional shift. This video continually surprised and excited me with action that struck the perfect balance between being visually digestable and fast enough to make for an exciting fight. I loved every twist and turn the story took, and every time I thought the video was about to end it just got two times more exciting until I eventually just had to accept that the video wouldn't be over until I was satisfied.   Alan Becker (and all the other awesome people involved) thank you so much for making these videos. They inspire me to improve myself as a game designer and story teller. I really appreciate your existence.

the fights in these videos tend to be a bit,, busy thats not a good or bad thing, i know its inherent to the stick fighting genere, if anything, it adds to the replay value, and adds a lot of spectacle to the videos. but theres just too much, and i know that sounds like a non argument, but itâ€™s hard to focus on all the cool stuff in the fights when thereâ€™s 4 different sources of action on screen at once. a step in the right direction is the slow mo, it keeps the fast pace of the fights in check, and makes memorable moments. 10:38 look at that, that was badass, because 1v1s compress the action into a more easy to digest way, no matter the fast and busy the fight is

In the pig potion thing there are a couple of things to note Resistance, absorption, slow falling, luck, water breathing, night vision, jump boost and haste show up twice Fire resistance and speed (one behind pigs face) shows up 3 times He gets invisibility but doesn't go invisible There are two custom potion effects being techno power and gotta go fast He gets effects you can't get from potions such as haste, conduit power, dolphins grace and absorption.  Some of the duplicate effects show up in their new and old versions. The ones that I mentioned are speed, fire red, jump boost and night vision If I missed anything let me know and I'll add them

Only in Alans videos can you see a block of sugar cane from Minecraft be badass.   Seriously dude, you and your team is super talented. I'm happy you all decided to continue animating and do your best to be creative and do what you love.   Any time I see a new video from you, I know I'm in for a treat. These videos for me, are always fantastic. They're fun, charming, have so much character and personality with barely a word of dialogue (which is super impressive btw), well put together, and almost never fail to make me smile.   To me, this channel is proof that if you have a passion for what you do, you can work hard and be able to not only continue doing what you love, but thrive with it. You can be successful, gain useful skills, and be happy just doing something you love. It won't happen overnight, and it will take a lot of hard work and effort, but the pay off is definitely worth it.    Bravo to you and your team, and thank you all for sticking with us through the nightmare that was 2020.  Here's hoping this year will be more productive and a little more happier for all of us. <3

okay okay enough with the meme comments, here comes the actual commentary of this video (apart from DJ's reacting directly lol)  I can see how much hours upon hours you've spent animating this episode. I noticed a LOT of separated entities and background details throughout the video and I can imagine the pain on how many layers you had to deal with per object. Even something as simple as Green being a sugar cane or Red as a *salmon.* a FISH-  This series has come to a seriously surprising twist! I love how smart you are to use most Minecraft aspects and put a little twist of your own imaginations.  Your characters can show so many expressions and emotions without faces or voices and that stuff is impressive as heck. The way you show how it feels to be Red, Green, Yellow and Blue's perspective as objects/animals is so creative, and how much you can add to a simple story about these stickmans. Even the pig! The pig can show emotions with a single face! And that's just amazing  The fact that this video is 14 minutes long yet so entertaining to watch is perfect! I'll always wait for the next upload from you

NICE! MORE OF THIS!
Alan, I dare say some of the strongest aspects of your combat is the contextual catharsis. You really know how to establish a villain and make it SATISFYING when they're beaten. You've established the Witch as cruel by separating all our dear friends and cheekily escaping all rightful retribution, typically through teleportation and transmogrification, and the action scenes that follow are cool but the Witch is always portrayed as a badass threat all the same through their own skills, even though they're still infuriating as a character.  The following action scenes provide the heroes a way to combat her tricks by reversing her transmogrification but that only goes so far and they're cornered.  And then we get to the final battle. The pig getting empowered is a cool as hell callback but what's even cooler is how the pig turns the witch's tricks right back on them. The teleportation fails as the pig simply follows her through the portal and proceeds to stunlock her out of pulling out any potions. And, just as when she gets her window of opportunity to throw one, it catches the potion and throws it right back before delivering the final blow. It was satisfying to see such an incredible fight scene and for the villain to get their comeuppance. You have a knack for this sort of storytelling, mate. :D
